questions.question: Although she works ……………………, she does not earn enough.
questions.description: Hard is the adverb for this meaning.

questions.question: I am ……………………….. happy to hear this.
questions.description: Very is used without much before adjectives.

questions.question: I don’t want to go into …………………….. about how I managed to do this.
questions.description: In detail means thoroughly or in depth.

questions.question: Chennai can be ……………………… hot in May.
questions.description: Either could be used here. Too can be used to show negative extremes.

questions.question: A soldier should never behave ……………………..
questions.description: Cowardly is an adjective. The adverb for this meaning is 'in a cowardly manner'.

questions.question: I feel …………………………….. about his health.
questions.description: Feel is a copular verb. It is modified by an adjective.

questions.question: They were ……………………….. injured in the crash.
questions.description: Badly and fatally are adverbs modifying verbs.

questions.question: I enjoy ………………………………. with my dogs.
questions.description: Enjoy is followed by an ing form.

questions.question: Although she ran ………………………., she could not win the race.
Read the instructions …………………………..
questions.description: Carefully is the adverb used to modify the verb read.
